quote: I can tell you that this race was one of the hardest things I've ever done. Sure, 177.6 miles is a long way to ride your bike, but we kept our effort in an easy Z1 and below the entire time. So the 'fitness' portion of this event was really not that bad. It was everything else.
The first 30 miles flew by...We were feeling good and moving along well above our goal pace. Seriously, who knew 20 extra psi in your tires could make such a difference.

The Francis Marion National Forest – or 'the Swamp' as we lovingly refer to it – has become one of my most favorite places on earth. And if you can believe it, it's even more magical at night. We traversed down endless dirt and gravel roads...

About halfway down Hell Hole Road A (OF COURSE it was HHRA) – I somehow managed to drop my chain in a way that it got caught between the frame and the small front chain ring...The chain was so jammed in there it took Geoff at least 5 minutes to get it unstuck.
A minimum of 28c wide tires with tread is recommended
Cyclocross, Gravel, Mountain and Road bikes will be allowed and can be used. The best choice would be a gravel bike.
The temperature was absolutely perfect – a balmy 60 degrees with light wind and a bit of fog/mist in the air when we were closer to the coast/Eastern side of the forest.

Most of the roads were in prime condition for riding, fast and smooth. Some were a little sandier than ideal (Old Georgetown road, I'm looking at you) and others were the hilarious type of chaos I've come to expect from the FMNF.
We are on one of the most remote roads out there

An 11 pm start is certainly rough, especially when you're an old lady like me who likes to be in bed by 8 pm...Nevertheless, this was not my first overnight rodeo, and the excitement of what was to come kept me alert and awake.

Riders should be prepared to fix anything that may come their way (flats, mechanicals, etc). The forest is remote and cell phone reception is not guaranteed. Please plan accordingly...There is no SAG wagon to pick you up. If you leave the course, we may not be able to find you.

10:30 AM - Empanada Cuisines and Roe Roe's Filipino Food trucks will be on site ready to serve post-ride food! All riders are encouraged to hangout in the finish area and share their stories of #gravelfreedom
Sunday, March 22, 2026 - 9:00 AM: Join us for a post-event Dirt Church sponsored by the Trek Bicycle Store of Mt. Pleasant! The ride usually features several route and pace options.

Swamp Fox Gravel Fondo Finisher Awards will be given to all finishers. Podiums for the top three finishers in each category (50 and 100 mile) will be held immediately following the Fondo. There is no podium for the 27-mile route.
